item.title: Computing π By Hand with a 1700 Year Old Algorithm
item.description: This post looks at computing by hand a result for pi using a process first described in the 3rd century. This same algorithm yielded the world’s most accurate valuation for the ratio of circle circumference to diameter until the 16th century.

item.title: Introducing Lurk: A programming language for recursive zk-SNARKs
item.description: We are excited to announce that the Lurk programming language repositories are now open to the public. Lurk is a Turing-complete programming language for recursive zk-SNARKs (zero knowledge Succinct Non-interactive ARguments of Knowledge) that will enable new possibilities for SNARK proofs, blockchain consensus, the Filecoin Virtual Machine (FVM), decentralized apps, data integration with IPFS and IPLD, and more.
item.author: (Filecoin)

item.title: Cities with Nice Weather
item.description: I live near Toronto. It’s springtime, and currently about 30 °C. In my opinion, Toronto is too hot in the summer and too cold in the winter. I’d like to know which cities have the least deviation from a tolerable average temperature.
item.author: (Jesse Onland)

item.title: Deploying a Static Site to Azure Using the az CLI
item.description: This post is about deploying a static sites to Azure storage account using Azure CLI and configuring GitHub actions to deploy the files. Recently I wrote a blog post on enabling Angular GZip encoding - in this post I am deploying the changes using Azure CLI and configuring a GitHub action to deploy the changes to storage account.
item.author: (Anuraj)
